section.heading: Medical assistance for other pregnant women

content.p: [§346-70] Medical assistance for other pregnant women. (a) The department may provide state-funded medical assistance to a pregnant woman age nineteen years of age or older whose countable family income does not exceed one hundred and eighty-five per cent of the federal poverty level for a family of applicable size, including the expected unborn children. The pregnant woman shall be: (1) A legal immigrant who entered the United States on or after August 22, 1996; and (2) Otherwise eligible for benefits under the State's medicaid program but is prohibited from participating in any medical assistance program under title XIX of the Social Security Act for a period of five years beginning on the date of her entry into the United States, due to restricted eligibility rules imposed by title XIX of the Social Security Act and the Personal Responsibility and Work [Opportunity] Reconciliation Act of 1996. (b) Once determined eligible for medical assistance under this section, the pregnant woman shall continue to be eligible throughout her pregnancy and through the last day of the calendar month in which the sixty-day period following childbirth ends. (c) Assets shall not be evaluated for eligibility purposes. (d) The director shall adopt rules pursuant to chapter 91 to determine eligibility for medical assistance. [L 2004, c 160, §2] Previous Vol07_Ch0346-0398 Next

The department may provide state-funded medical assistance to a pregnant woman age nineteen years of age or older whose countable family income does not exceed one hundred and eighty-five per cent of the federal poverty level for a family of applicable size, including the expected unborn children. The pregnant woman shall be:
A legal immigrant who entered the United States on or after August 22, 1996; and

Otherwise eligible for benefits under the State's medicaid program but is prohibited from participating in any medical assistance program under title XIX of the Social Security Act for a period of five years beginning on the date of her entry into the United States, due to restricted eligibility rules imposed by title XIX of the Social Security Act and the Personal Responsibility and Work [Opportunity] Reconciliation Act of 1996.

Once determined eligible for medical assistance under this section, the pregnant woman shall continue to be eligible throughout her pregnancy and through the last day of the calendar month in which the sixty-day period following childbirth ends.
Assets shall not be evaluated for eligibility purposes.
The director shall adopt rules pursuant to chapter 91 to determine eligibility for medical assistance. [L 2004, c 160, §2] Previous Vol07_Ch0346-0398 Next
